page.title: 12Family Life
page.content: As there is no village school,limited availability of employment,no shopping facilities,and a limited bus service, nearly every family in this area depend on their own transport,some travelling several miles to work. Primary children travel 5 miles,and secondary children 7 miles to the nearest schools. Some mothers go out to work, though most look after the homes. Most families have pets, television, telephones and hi_fi equipment. As this is a more remote village, the children are encouraged to persue outdoor activities, and full use of the village park is made. Cycling is very popular with the children and more parents are becoming interested as the trend for health and fitness continues. All the parents take a keen interest in their childrens welfare.
